Description: Painted pottery shabti of Bakenkhons with a blue lappet-wig, a red modelled face with black features and a red, blue and yellow collar that envelopes the parallel red hands; the leg section is inscribed with six rows of black painted Hieroglyphs and a similar column at the back, from chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead; the back is decorated with red and yellow representations of three seed-baskets.
Condition: fair - damage to surface at back
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Walter L Lawson
